_header: As I on hilly halkes lodged me late
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 195; cf. 27, considered as Epilogue.
Subjects: Joseph and Aseneth, story of; paraphrases; scripture texts, paraphrases
_description: Story of Joseph and Aseneth — 933 lines in rhyme royal stanzas and a Prologue of eight 4-line stanzas

HunEL26A13.First Lines:
As I on hilly halkes logged me lateBiside ny of a ladi sone was I
                    war…
HunEL26A13.Last Lines:
…Þus endeth the storie of asneth to your remembranceMy
                    rude translacion I pray you tak hit with plesance
HunEL26A13.Note:
With a prologue of 4 x 8; text after prologue begins, ‘Pharao the
                    famus kyng of egipt land a bout…’ (f. 116).
HunEL26A13.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble. 
             “The Storie of Aseneth.” 
             Journal of English and Germanic Philology
         9 (1910): 224-64: 226-64.
Peck,  Russell A.,
                        ed.  
             Heroic Women from the Old Testament in Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1991.
